channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump administration shares new moves to dismantle more of the Education Department
item.description: Opponents of the changes say Congress explicitly located some of these offices inside the Education Department, and the White House cannot legally mov...

item.title: Judge sides with Meta in antitrust trial, will not spin off WhatsApp and Instagram
item.description: A federal judge ruled against the Federal Trade Commission's antitrust suit alleging that Meta had stifled competition by buying up its rivals.

item.title: Farewell, fair penny. You are finished, but never forgotten
item.description: This tiny disc of zinc with just a smidge of copper has played an outsized role in our national (and international) discourse. The U.S. Mint ended pro...

item.title: Trump defends Saudi crown prince over question about killing of Khashoggi
item.description: President Trump lashed out a reporter in the Oval Office who was asking about allegations the crown prince orchestrated the killing of Washington Post...

item.title: U.S. deports dozens of migrants to Ukraine amid war
item.description: Immigration lawyers say those deported to Ukraine could be conscripted to fight in the war, contrary to international laws that prohibit deportations ...

item.title: Lebanon says Israeli strike killed 13 people near Palestinian refugee camp
item.description: The Israeli military says it was targeting members of Hamas "operating in a training compound". Hamas has not commented.

item.title: 10/14: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: President Trump: Hamas will disarm or “we will disarm them”; N.Y. Attorney General Letitia James makes first public appearance since federal indictmen...

item.title: The former Marine sniper accused of a mass shooting and the warning signs that came before
DoorDash to start delivering products bought at Family Dollar stores
item.description: Partnership lets consumers shop at 7,000 Family Dollar stores using the DoorDash app.

item.title: Brazil creates new Indigenous territories during protest-hit COP30
item.description: President Lula's government recognises 10 new Indigenous lands in an effort to protect their culture and environment.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo to visit White House on same day as Saudi crown prince
item.description: The Portuguese player is being paid handsomely to be part of the gulf state's modernisation plan.

item.title: Bodies of missing mum and child found in freezers in Austria
item.description: Public prosecutor Hansjörg Mayr says two men, aged 55 and 53, are being held on "strong suspicion of murder".

item.title: Person in custody after woman set on fire on CTA train
item.description: A person was in custody Tuesday after a woman was set on fire while riding a CTA Blue Line in Chicago's Loop the night before.

item.title: Suspected Hezbollah member goes on trial in Germany
item.description: The Shia Muslim group's military wing is proscribed as a terrorist organisation by the EU.

item.title: What Epstein files could be released by DOJ if Congress requires it?
item.description: If Congress passes — and President Trump signs — a bill requiring DOJ to release documents tied to investigations of Jeffrey Epstein, here's what coul...

item.title: Mayor says immigration agents have expanded enforcement action in North Carolina to Raleigh area
item.description: Federal agents have expanded their North Carolina immigration crackdown to the Raleigh area. That’s according to the mayor of the capital city.

item.title: Honda recalls nearly 257,000 cars over software flaw that can lead to power loss
item.description: Software error in some Honda Accord Hybrid vehicles can cause drivers to lose power, increasing the risk of a crash, NHTSA said.

item.title: As Trump expands immigration arrests into North Carolina, here’s what to know
